text: The activation of the Jak - <extra_id_0> STAT 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathway by <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in eosinophils .
The intracellular signal transduction of <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in eosinophils is unknown .
The objective of this study was to investigate the involvement of the newly discovered Jak-STAT pathway in the <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signal transduction mechanism .
Eosinophils were purified from peripheral blood by discontinuous Percoll gradients and stimulated with <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The involvement of <extra_id_0> Jak 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was investigated by immunoprecipitation followed by immunoblotting for tyrosine phosphorylation .
The activation of <extra_id_0> Jak 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was studied by autophosphorylation of the immunoprecipitated kinase .
<extra_id_0> Jak 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was tyrosine phosphorylated within 1 to 3 min after stimulation of eosinophils with <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Further , the immunoprecipitated <extra_id_0> Jak 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> obtained from <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - stimulated cells underwent autophosphorylation .
<extra_id_0> Jak 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> coprecipitated with the beta-subunit of the IL-5 receptor , suggesting a physical association of the kinase with the receptor .

The nuclear factor <extra_id_0> STAT-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> p91 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) was investigated by immunoprecipitation followed by immunoblotting for tyrosine phosphorylation .
<extra_id_0> STAT-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was tyrosine phosphorylated within 15 min of <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation .
The presence of <extra_id_0> STAT-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the nuclear extract was studied by electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
<extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced two proteins that bound to the gamma - activating sequence .
In the presence of an anti - <extra_id_0> STAT-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Ab , the band was supershifted .

Thus , we demonstrated that <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activated the <extra_id_0> Jak 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> STAT 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathway in eosinophils .

We speculate that the <extra_id_0> Jak 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> STAT 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> pathway may be involved in the activation of <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - inducible genes in eosinophils .
